intro: Melodinus glaber, commonly known as the smooth melodies, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in terminal umbels. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
